chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to a Witness

result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick P Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

adjournment request by Attorney Bricco.  Court grants adjournment request.
Restitution hearing at 12-18-2015 02:30 pm
to all parties regarding the exhibits from 4/10/2015 hearing.
from Erick Richardson
dated Nov 5, 2015 from Atty Katie Bricco regarding custody credit and requesting a restitution hearing

Defendant Erick P Richardson appeared by video conference.  Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties make initial statements.  Victim makes statements.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.


The Court Orders the Following:

1 year jail concurrent to any sentence (Credit - 152 days).
Restitution: $1013.90 to the victim (D.T.) listed in the criminal complaint to entered as a civil judgment.  
Fine or Costs: $278.00 to be paid immediately, failure to pay will result in 3 days in jail consecutive to this sentence.  
Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
OTP canceled and confirmed
